be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.forest

Class Forest

  • java.lang.Object
    • be.uclouvain.mlg.jForest.forest.Forest

  • public class Forest
extends java.lang.Object
    Generic definition of a random tree ensemble

    • Constructor Detail

      • Forest

        public Forest(Data d,
      int ntree,
      RandomSampler bootstrapSampler,
      SubsetSampler mtrySampler,
      java.lang.Class<? extends Splitter> nodeSplitterClass,
      InternalImportanceIF inImp,
      int maxDepth)
        Grow a forest with the corresponding specifications
        Parameters:
        d - the training data
        ntree - the number of trees
        bootstrapSampler - the sampler that randomly selects training instances for growing each tree
        mtrySampler - the sampler that randomly selects the candidate variables for splitting
        nodeSplitterClass - the class of the objects that perform variable based splits
        inImp - the aggregator of variable importance computed during the tree growing process
        maxDepth - the maximal depth of the decision trees. A negative value will cause to fully grow the trees.

    • Method Detail

      • predict

        public int[] predict(Data newdata)
        Predicts the labels of new, previously unseen, samples
        Parameters:
        newdata - the samples whose labels are to be predicted
        Returns:
        a vector of class labels in the same order as in newdata

      • getInternalImportance

        public double[] getInternalImportance()
        Returns the importance of each variable as an aggregation of their importance in each split
        Returns:
        variable importance vector

      • getExternalImportance

        public <E> E getExternalImportance(ExternalImportanceIF<E> eImp)
        Computes variable importance after the forest is grown. This sequentially updates eImp for each tree.
        Parameters:
        eImp - an aggregator of variable importance
        Returns:
        a data structure containing the importance of the variables

      • getNTree

        public int getNTree()
        Returns:
        the number of trees in the forest

      • getAvgDepth

        public double getAvgDepth()
        Returns:
        the average tree depth

        Overrides:

        public java.lang.String toString(boolean verbose)
        Sumarises the main parameters of the forest as a string
        Parameters:
        verbose - a boolean indicating if a string representation of all trees is to be computed
        Returns:
        a string representation of the forest
